questions.question_text: Which statement about tsidx files is accurate?

choices.D: Each bucket in each index may contain only one tsidx file.
choices.C: A tsidx file consists of a lexicon and a posting list.
choices.B: Splunk removes outdated tsidx files every 5 minutes.
choices.A: Splunk updates tsidx files every 30 minutes.

discussion.content: Anybody took this recently? i plan on taking it in a couple weeks... I also checked that site that NOTYOURGIRL said and it's BS lol they dont even have this exam on there

Selected Answer: C
The answer is C

The TSIDX is an index file such as a book summary. It contains a Lexicon and a Posting List.
The TSIDX is updated every 5 minutes and gets clean up for outdated data every 30 minutes. What is outdated data? We can think for example in data model acceleration, we have to select a timerange which our datamodel will be accelerate.

D is false, you have naturally one tsidx file, when you accelerate your DM you have two.

Selected Answer: A
if your search id is "myBaseSearch", then your base search should reference "myBaseSearch". Answer A is correct

For base search <search id="name">
Post-process <search base="myBaseSearch">

Selected Answer: A
Correct answer is A. See example under Basic post-process search on https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Viz/Savedsearches#Post-process_searches_2

questions.question_text: What is an example of the simple XML syntax for a base search and its post-process search?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
 search must include a transforming command (stats, timechart, top)
 only distributable streaming commands before the transforming command (or none).
 More than 100k events in the summary range
This could be unclear, but each bucket should be 100k or more, with search and transforming commands. So that would be C.

choices.A: Fewer than 100k events in search results, with transforming commands used in the search string.
choices.B: More than 100k events in search results, with only a search command in the search string.
choices.D: Fewer than 100k events in search results, with only a search and transaction command used in the search string.
choices.C: More than 100k events in the search results, with a search and transforming command used in the search string.

questions.question_text: What qualifies a report for acceleration?
What happens to panels with post-processing searches when their base search is refreshed?

choices.B: The panels are only refreshed if they have also been configured.

discussion.content: post-process searches automatically refresh when their base search is refreshed

questions.question_text: How is a cascading input used?

choices.A: As part of a dashboard, but not in a form.
choices.B: Without token notation in the underlying XML.
choices.C: As a way to filter other input selections.
choices.D: As a default way to delete a user role.

discussion.content:
C.
A cascading input is a way to filter other input selections
Think in a dashboard with 3 filters
COUNTRY | STATE | CITY
For a specific country, states are filtered to only show states of that country, same with city.
